articles.author: AARON KATERSKY
articles.summary: John Woeltz, 37, and William Duplessie, 33, are accused of kidnapping and torturing an Italian man in a New York City townhouse for over two weeks. He was stripped of his electronics, bound by the wrists, subjected to beatings, electric shock, a hit to the head from a gun and forced to smoke crack cocaine by holding him down or forcing a pipe into his mouth. articles.title: Russia records significant increase in crypto transactions due to Trump effect, the central bank says
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Bank of Russia expects continued support for the industry from the U.S. President's administration to further stimulate the market. Donald Trump's policy aimed at softer regulation of the crypto assets market has increased interest in the market, according to the Bank of Russia.

articles.title: What Federal Reserve Bank of Boston Says About Penny Production Ending in 2026
articles.author: Jolana Miller
articles.summary: The U.S. Mint will cease production of pennies early next year. According to the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, less than 20% of all transactions are made with cash. State and local governments will be responsible for providing guidance to retailers so that sales taxes are properly collected.
